page.title: 06HOME LIFE IN HIGHNAM
page.content: A questionaire conducted about home and village life revealed that out of 20 children from Highnam Primary School 75% lived on the Maidenhall estate while the remaining 25% lived nearby. The majority of 75% lived in semi- detatched houses,the remainder living in detatched. Only 2% had lived in Highnam more than 6 years and had live-in relatives Over 60% of the parents working, worked in Gloucester,and at least another 32% worked outside and around Gloucester,but even though 60% worked in Gloucester all the children said they would be attending Newent School the next year. An interesting factor was that only 20% of mothers didn't work and that each family had an average of 2 cars, if not more.
